title: How to Make Molasses Biscuits

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 170ºC/325ºF.
steps.description: Cover the baking tray (sheet) with baking (parchment) paper or foil.

steps.headline: Place all of the ingredients into the mixing bowl.
Add teaspoonfuls of the biscuit batter to the baking tray.
steps.description: Leave adequate room for expansion during cooking.

steps.headline: Place in the preheated oven to bake.
steps.description: Bake for 15 to 20 minutes. Don't overcook them.

steps.headline: Remove from the oven and allow to cool on a wire cooling rack.
Preheat the oven to 200ºC/180ºC fan forced/400ºF.
steps.description: Prepare the baking sheet or tray by lining with parchment or baking paper.

steps.headline: Add the butter, molasses and honey to the saucepan.
steps.description: Heat over medium head and stir occasionally to help the butter dissolve.

steps.headline: Remove from the heat.
steps.description: Set aside to cool a little.

steps.headline: Tip the flour, ground ginger and cinnamon to the cooled mixture.
steps.description: Mix well; note that the mixture will be sticky and quite stiff, so stir hard.

steps.headline: Make small balls of biscuit dough.
steps.description: Place onto the baking sheet or tray. Press down flatter with a fork.

steps.headline: Place in the preheated oven.
steps.description: Bake for 8 to 10 minutes, or until golden.

steps.headline: Remove from the oven.
steps.description: Allow to sit on the baking sheet or tray for 5 minutes, then transfer to a wire cooling rack to finish firming up.

text: Basic molasses biscuits Preheat the oven to 170ºC/325ºF. Cover the baking tray (sheet) with baking (parchment) paper or foil. Place all of the ingredients into the mixing bowl.  Add teaspoonfuls of the biscuit batter to the baking tray. Leave adequate room for expansion during cooking. Place in the preheated oven to bake. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes. Don't overcook them. Remove from the oven and allow to cool on a wire cooling rack.  Ginger and molasses biscuits Preheat the oven to 200ºC/180ºC fan forced/400ºF. Prepare the baking sheet or tray by lining with parchment or baking paper. Add the butter, molasses and honey to the saucepan. Heat over medium head and stir occasionally to help the butter dissolve. Remove from the heat. Set aside to cool a little. Tip the flour, ground ginger and cinnamon to the cooled mixture. Mix well; note that the mixture will be sticky and quite stiff, so stir hard. Make small balls of biscuit dough. Place onto the baking sheet or tray. Press down flatter with a fork. Place in the preheated oven. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes, or until golden. Remove from the oven. Allow to sit on the baking sheet or tray for 5 minutes, then transfer to a wire cooling rack to finish firming up. Serve when cooled.
